title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or translations and to score the response.

One point is awarded for each correctly translated segment. The student must correctly translate all words in a given segment to receive credit for that segment.

Note: The passage is segmented in such a way as to achieve a balance of easy, medium, and hard segments. Glosses are added to the passage only in order to make a given segment easier, so uncommon words in harder segments will not necessarily be glossed.

Note: The model translation provided below is merely a suggestion of how the passage might accurately be translated. Teachers should use their discretion in accepting alternative translations of any given segment.
descriptions:
The response does not accurately include any of the translations below.

· Segment 1: -que … -que [both/and … and]

· Segment 2: insequitur stridor [follows, comes after, ensues; creaking, rattling]

· Segment 3: clamor [shout, shriek, clamor, noise, roar, cry]

· Segment 4: virum rudentum [of men, men’s; of rope(s)]

· Segment 5: subito nubes [suddenly, unexpectedly, at once, quickly, immediately; (the) clouds (must be nominative)]

· Segment 6: eripiunt [rip, snatch, take (away), remove (from), seize]

· Segment 7: -que … -que caelum diem [both/and … and; sky, heaven(s), air (must be accusative); day, light, daylight (must be accusative)]

· Segment 8: Teucrorum ex oculis [of the Trojans, of the Teucrians, the Trojans’, the Teucrians’, Trojan; out of, from; (the) eyes, (the) sight, (must be the object of ex)]

· Segment 9: ponto incubat atra [the sea, ocean, water (must be object of incubat); lies upon, settles on(to), comes down on(to), comes down over; dark, black (must modify nox)]

· Segment 10: nox [night (must be nominative)]

· Segment 11: intonuere poli [(have) thundered, roared, resounded, groaned; (the) poles, heaven(s), sky/skies]

· Segment 12: (et) micat aether [(and); moves quickly to and fro, darts, flashes, glitters, vibrates, trembles, beats; the ether, sky, upper air(s), heaven(s) (must be nominative)]

· Segment 13: (et) crebris ignibus [(and); crowded, packed, constant, frequent, numerous (must modify ignibus); with fire(s), lightning]

· Segment 14: (-que) viris intentant omnia [(and); to the men, for the men; show(s), point(s), threaten(s), forecast(s), foreshadow(s); everything, all things (must be nominative)]

· Segment 15: (-que) praesentem mortem [(and); present, ready, apparent, sudden, instant (must modify mortem); death, destruction (must be accusative)]
